00033 *
00034 * Note(s)    : 1) Interrupts should be disabled during this call.
00035 *********************************************************************************************************

00062 /*
00063 *********************************************************************************************************
00064 *                                          TASK CREATION HOOK
00065 *
00066 * Description: This function is called when a task is created.
00067 *
00068 * Arguments  : ptcb   is a pointer to the task control block of the task being created.
00069 *
00070 * Note(s)    : 1) Interrupts are disabled during this call.
00071 *********************************************************************************************************
00072 */
00073 #if OS_CPU_HOOKS_EN > 0 
00074 void  OSTaskCreateHook (OS_TCB *ptcb)
00075 {
00076     ptcb = ptcb;                       /* Prevent compiler warning                                     */
00077 }
00078 #endif
00079

00090 *********************************************************************************************************

00099 /*
00100 *********************************************************************************************************
00101 *                                             IDLE TASK HOOK
00102 *
00103 * Description: This function is called by the idle task.  This hook has been added to allow you to do  
00104 *              such things as STOP the CPU to conserve power.
00105 *
00106 * Arguments  : none
00107 *
00108 * Note(s)    : 1) Interrupts are enabled during this call.
00109 *********************************************************************************************************
00110 */
00111 #if OS_CPU_HOOKS_EN > 0 && OS_VERSION >= 251
00112 void  OSTaskIdleHook (void)
00113 {
00114 #if 0
00115     LPM0;                                         /* Enter low power mode                              */
00116 #endif    
00117 }
00118 #endif

00137 /*$PAGE*/
00138 /*
00139 *********************************************************************************************************
00140 *                                        INITIALIZE A TASK'S STACK
00141 *
00142 * Description: This function is called by either OSTaskCreate() or OSTaskCreateExt() to initialize the
00143 *              stack frame of the task being created.  This function is highly processor specific.
00144 *
00145 * Arguments  : task          is a pointer to the task code
00146 *
00147 *              pdata         is a pointer to a user supplied data area that will be passed to the task
00148 *                            when the task first executes.
00149 *
00150 *              ptos          is a pointer to the top of stack.  It is assumed that 'ptos' points to
00151 *                            a 'free' entry on the task stack.  If OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 1 then 
00152 *                            'ptos' will contain the HIGHEST valid address of the stack.  Similarly, if
00153 *                            OS_STK_GROWTH is set to 0, the 'ptos' will contains the LOWEST valid address
00154 *                            of the stack.
00155 *
00156 *              opt           specifies options that can be used to alter the behavior of OSTaskStkInit().
00157 *                            (see uCOS_II.H for OS_TASK_OPT_???).
00158 *
00159 * Returns    : Always returns the location of the new top-of-stack' once the processor registers have
00160 *              been placed on the stack in the proper order.
00161 *
00162 * Note(s)    : The register passing convention for the IAR compiler is that the LEFTMOST two parameters
00163 *              are passed in registers:
00164 *              1st parameter:  R12 for a 16-bit value or,  R13:R12 for a 32-bit value
00165 *              2nd parameter:  R14 for a 16-bit value or,  R15:R14 for a 32-bit value
00166 *
00167 *              OSTaskStkInit() thus needs to place 'p_arg' in R12 since when the task is started, 'p_arg'
00168 *              is the FIRST argument of the task declaration:
00169 *
00170 *                 void  Task (void *p_arg)
00171 *                 {
00172 *                 }
00173 *********************************************************************************************************
00174 */
00175 
00176 OS_STK  *OSTaskStkInit (void (*task)(void *pd), void *p_arg, OS_STK *ptos, INT16U opt)
00177 {
00178     INT16U  *top;
00179 
00180 
00181     opt    = opt;                 
00182     top    = (INT16U *)ptos;
00183     top--;  
00184     *top = (INT16U)task;
00185     top--;
00186     *top = (INT16U)task;                          /* Interrupt return pointer                          */
00187     top--;
00188     *top = (INT16U)0x0008;                        /* Status register                                   */
00189     top--;
00190     *top = (INT16U)0x0404;
00191     top--;
00192     *top = (INT16U)0x0505;
00193     top--;
00194     *top = (INT16U)0x0606;
00195     top--;
00196     *top = (INT16U)0x0707;
00197     top--;
00198     *top = (INT16U)0x0808;
00199     top--;
00200     *top = (INT16U)0x0909;
00201     top--;
00202     *top = (INT16U)0x1010;
00203     top--;
00204     *top = (INT16U)0x1111;
00205     top--;
00206     *top = (INT16U)0x1212;           /* IAR Only */  /* Pass 'p_arg' through register R12                 */
00207     top--;
00208     *top = (INT16U)0x1313;
00209     top--;
00210     *top = (INT16U)0x1414;                         
00211     top--;
00212     *top = (INT16U)p_arg;           /* GCC uses r15 */
00213     return ((OS_STK *)top);    
00214 }
00215

00217 /*
00218 *********************************************************************************************************
00219 *                                           TASK SWITCH HOOK
00220 *
00221 * Description: This function is called when a task switch is performed.  This allows you to perform other
00222 *              operations during a context switch.
00223 *
00224 * Arguments  : none
00225 *
00226 * Note(s)    : 1) Interrupts are disabled during this call.
00227 *              2) It is assumed that the global pointer 'OSTCBHighRdy' points to the TCB of the task that
00228 *                 will be 'switched in' (i.e. the highest priority task) and, 'OSTCBCur' points to the 
00229 *                 task being switched out (i.e. the preempted task).
00230 *********************************************************************************************************
00231 */
00232 #if OS_CPU_HOOKS_EN > 0
00233 void  OSTaskSwHook (void)
00234 {
00235 }
00236 #endif
00237 
00238 /*
00239 *********************************************************************************************************
00240 *                                           OSTCBInit() HOOK
00241 *
00242 * Description: This function is called by OS_TCBInit() after setting up most of the TCB.
00243 *
00244 * Arguments  : ptcb    is a pointer to the TCB of the task being created.
00245 *
00246 * Note(s)    : 1) Interrupts may or may not be ENABLED during this call.
00247 *********************************************************************************************************
00248 */
00249 #if OS_CPU_HOOKS_EN > 0 && OS_VERSION > 203
00250 void  OSTCBInitHook (OS_TCB *ptcb)
00251 {
00252     ptcb = ptcb;                                           /* Prevent Compiler warning                 */
00253 }
00254 #endif
00255
